2.m: And the LORD God commanded the man, saying, 'You may surely eat of every tree of the garden, but of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil you shall not eat, for in the day that you eat of it you shall surely die.' - Genesis 2:16-17 (ESV)

l.a: God formed man from the dust from the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life.

l.q: What were God's commands to man in verses 15-17?
l.a: God commanded man to work and keep the Garden of Eden. God told man that he can eat of every tree of the garden except of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.

l.q: How did God create the woman?
l.a: God caused a deep sleep to fall upon the man, He took one of his ribs and made it into a woman.

2.p: Heavenly Father, I thank you for your good provisions. Thank you for your gift of life. Thank you for taking care of my needs - for the air and the sun, and for giving me food to eat. Thank you for health. Thank you for your gift of family, friends, people I work with, people I care for. Thank you for giving me work to do, and for giving me the skills and the strength to finish my tasks. May what I accomplish today be a reflection of your goodness. Thank you also for your commands and for showing me your ways. May I always bring you glory in my thoughts as well as in my deeds.
